instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2849: What is 820-2849? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> same cap issue as <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?
threads.message:
Are the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards susceptible to the same tantalum-capacitor failure as the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards? If so, what's the best procedure for replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9510</CAPACITOR>? The space to fit a proper poly-film cap is basically non-existent. What's the best way to cram proper caps in there without causing any issues? I have a few 2849 boards that seem to be having similar GPU power circuit issues, and I didn't see too much on here with regards to tantalum cap failure on the 2849 (relative to the 2850).

Thanks in advance as always.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> same cap issue as <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?
threads.message: No, on 2849 it is the GPU or VRAM.
